title: Water Safety and Swimming Education: Developing Practical Skills Based on Ecological Dynamics

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment, learners are professionals requiring systematic time management due to job characteristics. Emphasis on acquiring transferable skills for real-world application

learning_goals: Learners can recognize risk factors and explain coping strategies through learning modules simulating various aquatic environments (indoor pools, open waters).
Learners can perform breath control, buoyancy utilization, and basic swimming strokes (freestyle, backstroke) using online videos and mobile app practice tools.
Learners demonstrate situational judgment and decision-making abilities with over 85% accuracy in simulation-based assessments (e.g., responding to virtual river currents).

resources: Interactive Quiz and Scenario Assessment Tool
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
